newsitem.title: NORWAY: RGI sells shares in Avantor.
newsitem.headline: RGI sells shares in Avantor.

text.p: Norwegian investment group RGI N.V. (Norwa) ASA on Tuesday sold 2.36 million shares in real estate company Avantor ASA, the Oslo Bourse said in a statement.

"Following the sale RGI (Norway) now owns 1.15 percent of the shares in Avantor ASA," the statement said. "Also, RGI (Norway) ASA and RGI Inc. now own a total 49.99 percent of the shares in Avantor ASA."
Avantor, which closed unchanged at 52 crowns on the bourse, was the most traded stock of the day at 123 million crowns.
A string of disposals has been expected to take place in connection with the merger of RGI and engineering and offshore group Aker ASA.
Aker shareholders on November 21 voted overwhelmingly in favour of merging with RGI.
Currently registered in the Netherlands Antilles, RGI will transfer operations to Norway under the merger, which will take effect at the end of January.
The merged company will focus on three core areas -- seafood, cement and oil and gas.
